attributes.text:
A data cell renderer for the tree column of a simple tree

This cell renderer has provisions for subclasses to easily extend the appearance of the tree. If the tree should contain images, labels, etc. before the indentation, the subclass should override the method _addExtraContentBeforeIndentation(). Similarly, content can be added before the icon by overriding _addExtraContentBeforeIcon(), and before the label by overriding _addExtraContentBeforeLabel().

Each of these overridden methods that calls _addImage() can provide, as part of the map passed to _addImage(), a member called “tooltip” which contains the tool tip to present when the mouse is hovered over the image.

If this class is subclassed to form a new cell renderer, an instance of it must be provided, via the ‘custom’ parameter, to the TreeVirtual constructor.
Request preloading of images so they appear immediately upon rendering
Whether we have not yet requested pre-loading of images
File names of each of the tree icons
The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.
Adds extra content just before the icon.
The returned map contains an ‘html’ member which contains the html for the indentation, and a ‘pos’ member which is the starting position plus the width of the indentation.
The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.
Adds extra content just before the indentation.
The returned map contains an ‘html’ member which contains the html for the indentation, and a ‘pos’ member which is the starting position plus the width of the indentation.
The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.
Adds extra content just before the label.
The returned map contains an ‘html’ member which contains the html for the indentation, and a ‘pos’ member which is the starting position plus the width of the indentation.
The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.
Add the icon for this node of the tree.
The returned map contains an ‘html’ member which contains the html for the icon, and a ‘pos’ member which is the starting position plus the width of the icon.

How to display the image. It optionally includes any of the following:

position {Map}
If provided, a div is created to hold the image. The div’s top, right, bottom, left, width, and/or height may be specified with members of this map. Each is expected to be an integer value.
imageWidth, imageHeight
The image’s width and height. These are used only if both are specified.
Add an image to the tree. This might be a visible icon or it may be part of the indentation.
The html for this image, possibly with a surrounding div (see ‘position’, above).
The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.

Add the indentation for this node of the tree.

The indentation optionally includes tree lines. Whether tree lines are used depends on (a) the properties ‘useTreeLines’ and ‘excludeFirstLevelTreelines’ within this class; and (b) the widget theme in use (some themes don’t support tree lines).
The returned map contains an ‘html’ member which contains the html for the indentation, and a ‘pos’ member which is the starting position plus the width of the indentation.

The information about the cell. See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}. Additionally, if defined, the labelSpanStyle member is used to apply style to the span containing the label. (This member is for use by subclasses; it’s not otherwise used by this class.)
The position from the left edge of the column at which to render this item.
Add the label for this node of the tree.
The html for the label.
The column of indentation being requested, zero-relative
The node being displayed in the row. The properties of a node are described in {@link qx.ui.treevirtual.SimpleTreeDataModel}
Whether to find an appropriate tree line icon, or simply provide white space.
Whether to display the open/close icon for a node even if it has no children.

If bUseTreeLines is enabled, then further filtering of the left-most tree line may be specified here. If true then the left-most tree line, between top-level siblings, will not be displayed. If false, then the left-most tree line will be displayed just like all of the other tree lines.

Determine the symbol to use for indentation of a tree row, at a particular column. The indentation to use may be just white space or may be a tree line. Tree lines come in numerous varieties, so the appropriate one is selected.
map of image properties.

Returns the (computed) value of the property alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol}.
(Computed) value of alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol.

Returns the (computed) value of the property excludeFirstLevelTreeLines.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #excludeFirstLevelTreeLines}.
(Computed) value of excludeFirstLevelTreeLines.

Returns the (computed) value of the property useTreeLines.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useTreeLines}.
(Computed) value of useTreeLines.
Initial value for property alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #alwaysShowOpenCloseSymbol}.
the default value
Initial value for property excludeFirstLevelTreeLines.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property excludeFirstLevelTreeLines with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #excludeFirstLevelTreeLines}.
the default value
Initial value for property useTreeLines.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property useTreeLines with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useTreeLines}.
the default value

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

Set whether the open/close button should be displayed on a branch, even if the branch has no children.
When true, exclude only the first-level tree lines, creating, effectively, multiple unrelated root nodes.
Set whether lines linking tree children shall be drawn on the tree if the theme supports tree lines.
